caption.center: STATE OF HAWAI`I, Plaintiff-Appellee v. GEORGE LACY MOORE, III,

opinion.posture: APPEAL FROM THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE THIRD CIRCUIT (CASE. NO. 1474245MH)
opinion.panel: MOON, C.J., LEVINSON, NAKAYAMA, RAMIL, AND ACOBA, JJ.
opinion.opinion_text:
Upon review of the record, it appears that this court informed Appellant by letter dated July 19, 2002, that the time for filing the opening brief expired on July 10, 2002 and that, pursuant to Rule 30 of the Hawai`i Rules of Appellate Procedure, the matter would be called to the attention of the court for such action as the court deemed proper including dismissal of the appeal. Appellant having failed to respond to said letter or to otherwise oppose dismissal,
IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the appeal is dismissed.
